infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations1.o1.c1: The box contains bike horns, masks and oversized shoes. As you’re rummaging through it, a posse of people dressed in clown suits march down the hallway. One of them walks straight up to the box, picks it up and stares at you, then at your hand. You realize you’re still holding a bike horn in your hand.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations1.o1.o1: Apologize and put the horn back in the box.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations1.o1.o1.c1: The jester turns around stoically and continues on with the group, leaving you to scratch your head.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations1.o1.o2.c1: You raise the horn to your eye level and squeeze it. Instantly, chaos erupts among the group of clowns. They applaud, prance around and giggle uncontrollably, as if the sound of the horn were the funniest thing imaginable. One of them ruffles your hair approvingly.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations2.c1: A clown is loitering nearby. When he sees you approach, he perks up and tries to get your attention.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations2.o1: See what he has to say.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations2.o1.c1: The jester reaches out to you. In a similar motion, you raise your own arm and simultaneously you both honk each other’s noses. Twice, as is tradition when meeting a new brother. Without saying a word, he reaches into his pack and hands you a brand new bike horn. He salutes you and leaves, his footsteps squeaking rhythmically.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations2.o1.c2: Before you can react, the loathsome harlequin reaches out and painfully honks your nose.
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations2.o1.o1: Truly, they are a scourge on Europa.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.c1: You come across an unconscious worker. There are no signs of violence and nobody else is around.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o1.c1: The patient’s lips are blue, their breaths are short and shallow and their heart is beating very slowly. Telltale signs of Fentanyl overdose. Injection marks on their arm confirm your diagnosis.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o1.o1.c1: You treat the overdose with Naloxone. The patient is still unconscious, but their condition is stable.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o1.o1.c2: You have no Naloxone. All you can do at this point is make sure the patient's life is not in immediate danger and alert the local officials.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o1.o2: Give them basic first aid and alert the outpost doctor.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o1.o2.c1: You make sure the patient is stable and decide to let the local officials deal with the rest.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o1.c2: Well, he's unconscious all right. Probably just sleeping off a hangover or something.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o1.o3: Eh, that's the best I can do for now.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o2.c1: You find some spare change in their pocket, but a passerby catches you in the act. It seems looting injured people is frowned upon here.
infotexts.eventtext.goodsamaritan.o3: Step over their body and continue on.
infotexts.eventtext.propaganda.c1: A row of posters line the wall. It looks like the outpost directorial election is coming up. A gallery of stern-looking people are observing the hallway, conveniently grouped according to their political affiliation.
infotexts.eventtext.propaganda.o1.c1: Some of the Coalition Party’s boards have fallen victim to vandalism. “Bring power back to the hands of the people!” and “Down with the oligarchy!” are some of the catchphrases spray-painted on candidates’ faces. Separatists up to their usual tricks.
infotexts.eventtext.propaganda.o1.o1: Add some of your own flair too.
infotexts.eventtext.propaganda.o1.o1.c1: You draw some vulgar art of your own, then quickly move on before the fascists catch you in the act.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.c1: As you’re walking down the hallway, you catch a whiff of something sweet.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.c1: You sniff around and find the aroma coming from a nearby vent. Suddenly you feel very hungry.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.c1: You peer into the dark vent, trying to find out where it leads. No avail—the vents here are all connected. Even if you were to, say, climb in and follow the smell, you’d stand no chance of finding the sau–, er…source.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.o1.c1: It takes you no effort to remove the vent cover and wriggle inside. The smell is now intoxicating and it seems to come from every direction. Desperate, you start crawling. Eventually the vent splits into two paths. Something clicks in your head. This isn’t right.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.o1.o1: “I’ve come this far. Might as well keep going.”
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You pick a direction and crawl on. Suddenly it doesn’t smell so good anymore. The aroma has gradually turned into a sickly sweet, rotten stink. You start panicking as the tight walls begin closing in. Your vision blurs and everything goes dark. The last thing you see is a vaguely humanoid shape squirming toward your helpless body.
The next thing you know, you wake up outside the vent. Strangely, the vent is screwed shut and there are no signs of anyone having entered it. A quick inspection reveals you're uninjured, but your pockets are empty of change.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.o1.o2.c1: With great effort, you manage to turn around and make your way back to where you entered. While unhurt, you have a feeling you brought back something with you from the vents.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.o2: “What a fool I would be if I climbed in there…”
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.o2.c1: You chuckle at the idea of climbing into an air vent in a strange outpost in search of food. Even so, it takes some effort to leave the vent and the alluring aroma within.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o1.o2.o1: Now to get back to business.
infotexts.eventtext.goblincooking1.o1.o2: Ignore the siren call of the scent.
infotexts.eventtext.outbreak.c1: You overhear someone nearby talking to a radio. “Yeah, I gave them the eggs. Uh huh… Yeah. I made sure they swallowed ‘em. ...I don’t know, maybe three minutes ago?” That’s weird, you think to yourself. Hopefully nothing weird comes out of this.
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.c1: Someone has set up shop in their dorm room. A sign on the door says “Mike the Scryer: He’ll divine answers to all your questions!”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.o1.c1: You peek inside. Heavy curtains line the walls that are otherwise full of crudely drawn pictures of monsters, expensive submarines and well-endowed women. In the middle of the room is a round table with a couple of empty bottles of Europan moonshine and a crystal ball. A man wearing thick glasses and a sloppily tied turban is sitting behind the table. He squints and motions you to take a seat. “I’m Mike,” he croaks. “5 marks to ask me anything.”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.o1.o1.c1: You sit down at the table opposite Mike. A pungent smell of alcohol wafts from him. “Come on, then. What d’you wanna know about?”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.o1.o1.o1.c1: Mike conjures up a bottle of booze. “Real original.” He takes a swig. “There are a few schools of thought, but basically it boils down to this: Either you make life good for yourself or do good by others.” He reaches over the table to offer you a drink and knocks down a few bottles in the process. They shatter on the floor. “Shit.” Mike slumps down dejectedly. “There’s no God,” he mutters as he pushes himself up and starts for the cleaning closet. “Session’s over.”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.o1.o1.o2: “What do you reckon is in the center of Europa?”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.o1.o1.o2.c1: Mike blinks. “What? I don’t know. Lava? Or is it magma in this case?” He turns toward a bunk. “Hey Jimmy! Is it lava if it’s underground or magma?” A bundle of sheets stirs a bit. “What is–? Fuck off Mike, I’m sleeping,” it mumbles back. Mike scratches the back of his head. “It’s gotta be one or the other. What else could it be?” He chuckles and flashes his rotting teeth. “A gateway to Earth? Ridiculous.”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.o1.o1.o3.c1: “Funny little fuckers, aren’t they?” Mike leans back in his chair. It squeaks in protest. “The legend has it that a cargo ship carrying entertainment supplies wrecked somewhere near Uusi-Turcu. They recovered a single survivor weeks later. She was wearing a striped shirt, rubber mask and gibbering something about a “Honkmother” who had kept her company.” He picks his nose and pensively inspects his findings. “Ever since, there’s been a group of ‘em what worships the Honkmother.” “Really?” you ask, enthralled. He flicks the booger off. “No. But that’s all I got.”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.c1: You run into a familiar face. It seems Mike the fortune teller has found his way here. This time he’s wearing a janitor’s overalls and is in the process of mopping up a puddle of what seems like someone’s former breakfast.
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.o1.c1: “Oh, hey. Yeah, I figured it was time to bounce after the... You know, the incident. With the reactor.” You decide not to delve deeper. “I still have plenty of wisdom to dispense. 5 marks or a pack of cigarettes.”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.o1.o1.c1: He leans on his mop. “So what can I help you with?”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.o1.o1.o1.c1: Mike takes out a cigarette and puts it in his mouth. “Guess it’s still out there. A bit worse for wear though, am I right?” He flashes a toothless smile and fishes out a lighter from his pocket. “I had a pen pal there a few years back, you know? A real prolific writer. No wonder, you ought to get a lot of writing done with twelve fingers.” He lights the cigarette, takes a drag and coughs his lungs out. “Fuck me!” He exclaims after the fit subsides. “People really smoke these things?” He tosses the whole pack in the trash. “Not for me.”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.o1.o1.o2.c1: “Oh, them? Natural selection. Some things are just better suited for survival.” He rolls up his sleeve, revealing a crude tattoo that states: “I fuck with boots on.” He continues: “Tougher. Faster. Prettier. Only the strong come out on top.” A passerby tosses a soda can on the floor and Mike bends to pick it up. “Apex predators, that’s what we are,” he declares as he places the can in the trash.
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.o1.o1.o3: “Why would someone shoot a man before throwing him out of an airlock?”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.o1.o1.o3.c1: “It’s all part of the plan,” Mike muses. “Sending a message. You gotta assert dominance, otherwise you get no respect.” He gets back to mopping the puke off of the floor. “It’s how you survive on a submarine, same as in prison.” “You were incarcerated?” you ask. “Oh, I’ve been all around. I tell you, the things you have to do to get respect... I still have trouble walking straight.”
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot2.o1.o2: Act like someone’s calling you on the radio.
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot.nomoney: “Mike knows many things, and he'll tell you some. But only if you have the coin.”
infotexts.eventtext.firefighting.c1: You notice a thin trail of smoke rising from a trash can.
infotexts.eventtext.firefighting.o1.c1: There is a lit cigarette in the trash. It seems dangerously close to igniting a larger flame.
infotexts.eventtext.firefighting.o1.o1.c1: You get some minor burns when you fish the cigarette out and stomp out the fledgling fire, but nothing major.
infotexts.eventtext.sleightofhand.c1: Some workers are huddled together, playing a game with dice. They have piled various items together, presumably as prizes for the winner. Among them is a shiny, symmetrical item. You recognize it as alien, and probably worth more than the other items combined.
infotexts.eventtext.sleightofhand.o1: Join the game and attempt to win the item for yourself.
infotexts.eventtext.sleightofhand.o1.c1: You quickly deduce that it’s a game of pure luck. You take a few careful risks and it pays off. You walk away with the prized alien ornament.
infotexts.eventtext.sleightofhand.o1.c2: Unsurprisingly, the other players are more experienced in the game than you. After betting a sizeable amount of cash, you walk away with nothing. You have lost 500 marks.
infotexts.eventtext.sleightofhand.o2: Create a distraction and try to snatch it without anyone noticing.
infotexts.eventtext.sleightofhand.o2.c1: You start yelling “Fire! Fire!” and quickly grab the item in the ensuing chaos. You hide it deep in your pocket. It’s time to go before they’re any wiser.
infotexts.eventtext.sleightofhand.o2.c2: You start yelling “Fire! Fire!” and quickly grab the item in the ensuing chaos. However, one of them catches you in the act and calls security.
infotexts.eventtext.foreshadowing.c1: You feel the faintest of tugs near your pants. When you finally get some space, you find someone has slipped a note in your pocket.
infotexts.eventtext.foreshadowing.o1.c1: It states: “The truth is out there. cbspusbvnbhbnf.dpn/efsfmjdu/beweht.htm”
infotexts.eventtext.separatistrelations.c1: You run into some separatists. Being on friendly terms with them, you receive some insight into how this place functions.
infotexts.eventtext.separatistrelations.c2: You see some separatists creating their trademark art on an unsuspecting trash can.
infotexts.eventtext.separatistrelations.o1.c1: “Hey! That’s official property!” you decide to yell. The youngsters stop what they’re doing and attack you.
infotexts.eventtext.separatistrelations.o2.c1: You act as a lookout for the two activists. When they finish their masterpiece, you exchange a few words. They deem you loyal to their cause and promise to put a good word in for you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultrelations.c1: Someone is handing out flyers advertising some kind of a communion. You spot a familiar-looking logo in the corner. It’s just the local husk cult members proselytizing. It might be fun to check out the ritual.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultrelations.o1: Sure, what’s the worst that could happen?
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultrelations.o1.c1: You make your way into the advertised dorm. It’s the usual stuff: “Fleshbags” this and “ascension” that. The local chapter guys are very friendly and they invite you to partake of the communion.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultrelations.o1.o1.c1: You gulp down some husk eggs. A bit salty. Afterwards you joke around with the folks a bit and you part in good spirits. You’ve made some lifelong friends here tonight. That reminds you to pick up some husk antidote at the counter and take some of it pretty soon-ish.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultrelations.o1.o2: Make up an excuse to leave.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultrelations.o2: Suicide cults are fun but not for me.
infotexts.eventtext.engineers_are_special.c1: The engineering crew chief working on a beaten-up old shuttle engine scowls at you for a moment, as if sizing you up.
infotexts.eventtext.engineers_are_special.c1.c1: You there, you look halfway competent. Give me a hand with this engine.
infotexts.eventtext.engineers_are_special.c1.o1.c1: You decline as tactfully as you can but he’s clearly not happy. He shakes his head and silently goes back to work, trying to refit the engine.
infotexts.eventtext.engineers_are_special.c1.o2.c1: You roll up your sleeves and get to work refitting the engine with him. After a few minutes of work you both manage to get it running. “Thanks. I’m sure I’d have got it going on my own eventually but you’ve saved me some time. Let me know if you want any work done on your sub and I’ll see about giving you a little discount for your trouble.”
infotexts.eventtext.engineers_are_special.c1.o2.c2: You roll up your sleeves and get to work refitting the engine with him. In spite of your best efforts though, the engine refuses to start. He slams shut the access panel. “Well I guess this is one for the scrappers. Thanks for the help anyhow.”
infotexts.eventtext.engineers_are_special.c1.c2: He clearly doesn’t care much for what he sees and returns to his work. Apparently you’ve somehow not passed muster.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.c1: Two workers are arguing loudly. What once might have been a civil discussion about inter-Europan politics has devolved into a shouting match—it isn’t readily apparent how the other guy’s mother factors into it.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1: Try to calm the situation down.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.c1: You move a bit closer. For a moment, the two loudmouths stop arguing and look at you.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.o1: “Hey fellas. Not my place to interrupt, but they can hear your conversation back in Versas.”
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.o1.c1: The two workers are humbled by your parental demeanor. They quiet down and get back to their duties.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.o1.c2: They are even more pissed off now, but this time at you. Your condescending manner of speaking does you no favors.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.o2: “I suggest you two shut your traps before I finish counting to three. One…”
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.o2.c1: They get the feeling you have the means to back up your words. The two workers go quiet in a record time.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.o2.o1.c1: They look at each other. Clearly, they’re shaking in their boots.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o1.o2.o1.o1.c1: A smile appears on the other’s face and you smile at him in turn. You feel powerful. Your smile quickly turns into a frown when they grab their tools and walk toward you with ill intent.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o2.c1: You don’t know exactly what’s going on, but join in the shouting anyway. “Remember what he said about your mom?” “That shit doesn’t fly where I’m from!” You feel giddy as the shouting crescendos into a fistfight and the two workers start reaching for their tools. It might be a good time to vanish from the area.
infotexts.eventtext.mediator.o3: Nothing to see here. Keep walking.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.c1: “Hey! Got something for ya here if you’re interested…”
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1: Listen to what they have to say.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c1: “I happened to find some nice alien contraband. It’s yours for 1,000 marks. I’ll throw in a power cell too. What do you say?” He opens his coat to reveal a pistol that looks like genuine alien tech.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c1.c1: Do you want to buy the pistol for 1,000 marks?
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c1.o1.c1: He hands you the pistol. It’s a genuine article.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c1.o1.c2: He shoves the pistol in your hand and quickly shuffles off. On a closer look, the pistol is actually a children’s toy. You angrily toss it aside.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2: “I found some weird eggs in the vents. Dunno what they are but figured they’d mean something for someone like you.” He flashes some eggs but it’s too dark to make out which species. He quickly hides them before you can ascertain their nature. “500 marks.”
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2.c2: Do you want to buy the eggs for 500 marks?
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2.o1.c1: He carefully places the eggs in your hand. Most of them are actually oversized marbles, but one is a genuine mudraptor egg. “This can potentially cause a lot of damage,” you think to yourself as you stow it safely inside your jacket.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2.o1.c2: In the light, the eggs are instantly recognizable as “Velonaceps Calyx,” otherwise known as husk eggs.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.nomoney: “Not enough cash? I thought the submarine business paid well...”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.c1: “Hello, fellow traveler!” a pale figure greets you. You’re slightly taken aback by their cheerfulness. “Would you happen to have any eggs of the species Velonaceps Calyx? I’ll pay good money for each one you come across in your travels.” Their facade momentarily slips and you can hear them muttering under their breath. You can make out “disgusting meatsack” and something about “ascending.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.c1: You check your pockets. As luck would have it, you have some husk eggs on you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o1.c1: You exchange the eggs for money, which you count immediately. It's all there.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o2.c1: You decide to donate the eggs for free. The person seems overjoyed.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o3: Actually, I'll keep these for now.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.c2: You check your pockets. You're fresh out of husk eggs.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o4: “I don't have the eggs on me but I'll go get some.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o4.c1: “I'll be here,” the person whispers. It sends shivers down your spine.
infotexts.eventtext.fanclub.c1: A crowd of teens has gathered to observe the newcomers to their outpost. They’re loudly arguing about which is the coolest job on board a submarine.
infotexts.eventtext.fanclub.o1.c1: They have an endless amount of questions. You answer them diligently, and in the end you have the feeling a few of them are going to grow up to be seafarers. Remember: If they wind up as crawler food, it’ll be blood on your hands.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.c1: Two pale characters with bags under their eyes approach. They’re reaching for something under their clothes. You feel threatened.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o1.c1: The two figures draw out sharp knives and lunge at you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o2: “Easy, dear brothers. My time for ascension isn’t here yet.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o2.c1: They stop their approach, apologize for the confusion and the three of you grab some crawler cocktails and laugh it off. They share information on this outpost.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o2.c2: The two figures draw out sharp knives and lunge at you.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo1.c1: “We hired a crew to transport these materials, but they never showed. The stuff is still here if you want the job.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo2.c1: “Got some real 'handle with care' cargo sitting in the bay. Normally I wouldn't trust them with any new face but I hear you've proved yourselves.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo3.c1: “These research materials are sorely needed in the neighboring outpost. It's imperative they get to their destination intact.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killswarm.c1: “No transport ship can leave without running into a swarm of monsters. Take care of the problem and there's a reward in it for you.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killmonstercommon: “There's this especially mean monster terrorizing the caves near here. I've put a little reward aside for the crew that takes it down.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killmonsterrare.c: “I've heard reports of a gargantuan monster somewhere in the vicinity. If you want to try hunting it down, be my guest. Just make sure you're prepared. It's a dangerous one.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvageartifact.c: “We picked up a signal nearby. The eggheads say it could be something alien. If you check it out, there'd be some marks in it for you.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvagewreck.c1: “We received a distress signal from a vessel that was carrying some sensitive cargo. The contents are probably long gone by now but the captain's logbook should shed some light on what happened to it. I want you to recover it.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killmonster.c1: “I posted about an assignment earlier. Sent the details to your onboard navigation system too, in case you're interested.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo.c1: “I posted about an assignment earlier. Sent the details to your onboard navigation system too, in case you're interested.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvage.c1: “I posted about an assignment earlier. Sent the details to your onboard navigation system too, in case you're interested.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_clownoutbreak.c1: There are flyers with notices for various jobs. One of them is for ferrying a few boxes of clowning equipment to a neighboring outpost. It states: “If interested, imitate your favorite bird.”
A distant sound of a bike horn confirms you as the recipient of the assignment. A container is waiting for you when you leave the outpost.
A distant sound of a bike horn confirms you as the recipient of the assignment. A container is waiting for you when you leave the outpost.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1: An announcement comes over the PA. “Calling the crew of the vessel that just docked. Please send a representative to see the security chief in administration.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1: “You're one of the new arrivals? Good. I have a sensitive issue I can't trust any of my own employees with.” The chief pauses for a second, sizing you up, then continues. “In usual circumstances, I wouldn't ask for help from just anyone, but I'm running out of options. Needless to say, I need you to keep this to yourself. Are you interested?”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.o1.c1: The chief nods. “According to intel we managed to gather earlier, we can expect a separatist prison break soon,” they state, matter-of-factly. “Prison breaks are already a nasty business, but to complicate matters I have reason to believe they have a man on the inside.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.o1.o1.c1: “I'm talking about inside the security force.” It seems like sense of humor isn't how one makes it to chief of security. “To cut to the chase, I need to make sure all my personnel are on the level and take precautions. Here's what I want you to do. Take these microphones and hide them in the crew quarters.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You pick up some small surveillance microphones. “One more thing. I can't permit this kind of surveillance in an official capacity. If you get caught, you're on your own.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.c1: These must be the quarters the chief was talking about.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.c1: You quickly stuff the mics in footlockers under the bunks. The sound coming through is a bit muffled but serviceable. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.c2: You toss the mics under a bunk. When you turn around to leave, you run into a security guard. “What are you up to?” they ask.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1: “Oh, just some calisthenics. Need to stay in shape for emergencies.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c1: The guard seems satisfied with the explanation and goes back to their rounds. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c2: “You look like you've never done an honest day's work in your life.” They start inspecting undersides of the bunks. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c2.c2: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o2.c1: The guard lets out a brief chuckle. “A funny guy. You shouldn't be here. Go on, git.” The guard then turns their attention to the cameras. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o2.c1.c1: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c1: You open up a nearby transistor radio and install a microphone inside the speaker, out of sight. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c2: You spot a transistor radio that could possibly hold a microphone. As you're fiddling with it, a security guard calls out. “You! Come here!” You decide to comply for now. “What were you doing?” the guard demands.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o1.c1: “Finally. Make sure K-Rawler comes through loud and clear.” Something will come through all right, you think to yourself. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o1.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o2.c1: The guard lets out a brief chuckle. “A funny guy. You shouldn't be here. Go on, git.” The guard then turns their attention to the cameras. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o2.c1.c1: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.c1: In a nearby trash can, there are two small bottles of clear liquid. Both of them are labeled with a different chemical formula.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1: Take a closer look at the bottles.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.c1: Neither solution is anything you’re especially familiar with, but you are reasonably sure one of them is strongly acidic. You decide to leave the acid be. The other bottle is a total mystery to you.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.c1: The solution has a slightly mellow and sweet quality to it and it leaves a lingering aftertaste of apricot. It seems to have no other effects. You decide to leave the bottles in the trash and continue on.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.c1: After a while, you realize drinking the solution has made all your pains disappear. For the first time in forever, you feel good. You don't know what the solution is but you wish you had some more. Maybe there's some more in the trash?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.o1: Maybe I should take another look in there.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You return to the trash can and find a couple more bottles. None of them are the same as the one you drank but maybe they can be of some other use.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o2: Not a very sensible thing to do...
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.c2: Chemistry makes no sense to you; it might as well be an alien language. After a quick shake test, either liquid seems perfectly safe to you. One of them has a blue label, the other green. Do you want to try one of them?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.c1: The solution has a slightly mellow and sweet quality to it and it leaves a lingering aftertaste of apricot. It seems to have no other effects. You decide to leave the bottles in the trash and continue on.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.c1: After a while, you realize drinking the solution has made all your pains disappear. For the first time in forever, you feel good. You don't know what the solution is but you wish you had some more. Maybe there's some more in the trash?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.o1: Maybe I should take another look in there.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.o1.c1: You return to the trash can and find a couple more bottles. Maybe one of these is the same miracle solution!
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o4.c1: The liquid burns your throat a bit when you swallow it. At first, the effect isn’t unlike a good Jovian vodka, and the prospect of getting buzzed while spending no money appeals to you greatly. The situation suddenly takes a turn for the worse when you feel like your stomach is on fire. A sharp pain causes you to double over in agony. Who would’ve thought drinking something out of the trash was a bad idea?
infotexts.eventtext.crawleroutbreak.c1: A panicked researcher runs past you. “God dammit Jimmy, I told you we should’ve went with padlocks instead of these electronic pieces of shit!”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.c1: As you step inside the office, the manager notices you. “I suppose you're here about the situation in the mines?” he asks.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1: “Uh...sure. Remind me what the situation was, again?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.c1: It turns out the miners have halted the work in the mines because of a toxic gas leak. “They're demanding ridiculous hazard pay and we just don't have the budget for that. That's why you're here, right? To negotiate a better deal?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1: “Yes, that's right. Get me in contact with the foreman.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1: “They can probably be found near the main mineshaft. Good luck.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.c1: The foreman is pacing back and forth, loudly arguing with someone on the radio. You only catch the tail end of their discussion. “There aren't enough diving masks for the whole crew. Even if there were, we couldn't waste the oxygen keeping them on all day long. ...No, the ventilation in the mines is connected to the rest of the outpost so we can't risk pumping it out either.” Exasperated, he looks at you. “Are you here about the gas leaks?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2: “What kind of gases are we talking about?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.c1: “Mercury gases. Colorless, odorless, gives you breathing problems real quick.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1: Come up with a solution to help with mercury exposure.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1.c1: “A combination of iron, Stabilozine and crawler liver should keep your lungs clean of mercury. Take two pills every six hours.” The foreman thanks you for your advice. You collect a considerable reward from the outpost manager.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1.c2: You can't come up with anything that could help the situation.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3: “Tell me more about the ventilation problem.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.c1: “The ducts reach from here all the way to the mess hall and dorms, meaning we can't pump the vapors out. I don't know who installed them originally, but I'd like to have a word with 'em.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1: Attempt to solve the ventilation problem.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1.c1: You study a map of ventilation ducts. “Why not install an extra air filtration system right here?” you suggest, pointing to a junction near the dorms. “Should pump out all the mercury before it spreads farther.” And sure enough, it does. You collect a fee from the manager for solving the problem.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1.c2: You can't come up with anything that could help the situation.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o2: “This is above my pay grade. Goodbye.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.c1: “Do you have the eggs with you now?”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.c1: You check your pockets. As luck would have it, you have some husk eggs on you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o1.c1: You exchange the eggs for money, which you count immediately. It's all there.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o2.c1: You decide to donate the eggs for free. The person seems overjoyed.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o3: Actually, I'll keep these for now.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.c2: “No, you don't. Please stop wasting my time.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_collectminerals.c: “There's been talk of valuable mineral clusters nearby. We'd like you to see if there's any truth to the rumors.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_mudraptornest.c1: “A couple of divers stumbled upon a mudraptor nest full of eggs in a nearby cave. We obviously don't want a swarm of raptors in our backyard, so if you can get rid of those eggs we'd happily pay you.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_crawlernest.c1: “A couple of divers discovered a bunch of crawler eggs in a nearby cave. We don't need any more crawlers near the station, so I've put a little reward aside for the crew that wipes out the nest.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_tigerthreshernest: “A couple of divers discovered a thresher nest full of eggs in a nearby cave. We don't want to see those things hatching, and there's a reward in it for any crew that makes sure they won't.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_beacon.c1: “We could use a hand getting one of our beacon stations back online and transmitting so we can start building a new outpost out there. There's some marks in it for you and your crew if you can set it right.”
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasewallhealth: Increase submarine hull durability. Makes the walls less vulnerable to damage and allows the submarine to dive deeper without getting crushed by pressure.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasedeterioration: Equipment will take longer to start deteriorating.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreaselowskillfixdu: Decrease the amount of time needed to repair equipment when unskilled.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreaserequiredskill: Decrease the skill level required to repair items.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasefabricationsp: Decrease the time needed to fabricate items.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasefabricationsk: Lower the skill levels required for item fabrication.
infotexts.upgradedescription.turretincreaserotatio: Increase the rotation rate of all guns when operated by insufficiently skilled crew.
infotexts.upgradedescription.turretincreaseoffseto: Increase the view range of all weapons.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increaseoxygengenerat: Increase the amount of oxygen generated.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasemeltdowndelay: Increase the time reactors can stay at critical temperature before meltdown.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasemaxpumpflow: Increase the speed at which water is pumped in or out of the sub.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasefireprobabili: Decrease the probability of fires occurring.
infotexts.upgradeui.title: 船廠
infotexts.itemrepairs.purchasepromptbody: 你想要以[amount]馬克修復潛艇上所有的設備嗎？
infotexts.wallrepairs.purchasepromptbody: 你想要以[amount]馬克修復潛艇船體嗎？
infotexts.replacelostshuttles.purchasepromptbody: 你想要以[amount]馬克替換遺失的小艇嗎？
infotexts.upgraderefundbody: 已退還等待中升級的費用。
infotexts.suppliespurchasedmessage: 你購買的物品將在離開[location]之後送達你的潛艇。
infotexts.campaignstore.sellwarningtext: 你確定要賣出這些物品嗎？
infotexts.campaingstore.valueincreasetooltip: 購買列表中的物品會使商人的存款增加並讓他們在未來能夠販賣更多品項！
infotexts.campaingstore.valuedecreasetooltip: 賣出列表中的物品會使商人的存款減少並讓他們在未來能夠販賣的品項變少。
infotexts.crewhiredmessage: 新招募的船員將會在你離開[location]之後加入。
infotexts.purchaseandswitchsubmarinetext: 以[amount][currencyname]購買[submarinename1]並替換你目前的潛艇（[submarinename2]）？
infotexts.deliveryrequesttext: 以[amount][currencyname]將[submarinename1]自[location1]運送至你所在的[location2]並替換你目前的潛艇（[submarinename2]）？
infotexts.notenoughmoneyfordeliverytext: [currencyname]不足以將[submarinename]自[location1]運送至你所在的[location2]！
infotexts.votealreadyactivetext: 已經有一項投票正在進行！!
infotexts.submarineswitchfeevote: [playername]想要以[amount][currencyname]將潛艇[submarinename]自[locationname]運送過來，並以其替換目前的潛艇。
infotexts.submarinepurchaseandswitchvotepassed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，同意以[amount][currencyname]購買[submarinename]並以其替換目前的潛艇。
infotexts.submarinepurchasevotepassed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，同意以[amount][currencyname]購買[submarinename]。
infotexts.submarineswitchfeevotepassed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，同意以[amount][currencyname]將潛艇[submarinename]自[locationname]運送過來，並以其替換目前的潛艇。
infotexts.submarineswitchnofeevotepassed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，同意以[submarinename]替換目前的潛艇。
infotexts.submarinepurchaseandswitchvotefailed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，不同意以[amount][currencyname]購買[submarinename]並以其替換目前的潛艇。
infotexts.submarinepurchasevotefailed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，不同意以[amount][currencyname]購買[submarinename]。
infotexts.submarineswitchfeevotefailed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，不同意以[amount][currencyname]將潛艇[submarinename]自[locationname]運送過來，並以其替換目前的潛艇。
infotexts.submarineswitchnofeevotefailed: 隊伍在[yesvotecount]同意、[novotecount]不同意的票數下，不同意以[submarinename]替換目前的潛艇。
infotexts.faction.coalition.description: 實質掌握木衛二的專制力量，它的管轄遍佈各地且以鐵腕掌握了原料、製造、與能源。製造恐懼是它們的治理方法，將不服從它們的殖民地和哨站排除在供應鏈之外、甚至透過武力直接使其屈服都不是新聞。它們的最高目的是確保人類的存活，但不惜任何代價，且最好在不撼動它們的領導之下進行。
infotexts.faction.coalition.shortdescription: 實質掌握木衛二的專制力量，它的管轄遍佈各地且以鐵腕掌握了原料、製造、與能源。
infotexts.faction.clowns.description: 每隔一段時間，那些流浪藝人、傻瓜、和小丑就會試著組織工會，那陣子「木衛二雜技協會」之類的組織就會出現。但實際上小丑聖母之子不過只是群聽從自行車喇叭召喚的烏合之眾。
infotexts.faction.clowns.shortdescription: 小丑聖母之子純粹是群聽從自行車喇叭召喚的烏合之眾。
infotexts.faction.separatists.description: 一個不擇手段追求更加民主的社會的小規模地下組織，他們會發動示威甚至是恐怖行動，旨在干擾聯盟的運作並削弱它的權威。
infotexts.faction.separatists.shortdescription: 一個不擇手段追求更加民主的社會的小規模地下組織，他們會發動示威甚至是恐怖行動。
infotexts.faction.huskcult.description: 遊走法外，帶著超人類主義的神祕信仰團體，他們尋求與畫皮寄生蟲進行「交流」以恭迎更適於生存在這個嚴峻的環境、更能融入生態系統、且屏除傲慢、憎恨、恐懼、或過多思考能力的新人類。不論是聯盟或是分離主義份子都對他們沒有好感。
infotexts.faction.huskcult.shortdescription: 一個尋求與畫皮寄生蟲進行「交流」以恭迎更適於生存在這個嚴峻的環境、更能融入生態系統的新人類的信仰團體。
infotexts.toofarfromoutpostwarning: 哨站下正在游泳的人，請快點回來，外面不安全。
嘿！對、你，哨站下的那個 － 你想幹嘛？我從聲納上看到你的時候還以為你是一隻爬行者！快回來免得你被其他手癢的槍手幹掉。
在哨站下潛水的人員：請立刻折返，你快游出我們的聲納範圍之外了，而我不想要為了你去麻煩搜救小組。
infotexts.campaignend1: 未明的啟示在你的眼前閃爍：一處水晶般的深淵，一個未知的存在沉眠其中... 但你還沒有做好面對這一切的準備，只能順著暗流與世沉浮...
infotexts.campaignend2: 它存在於有序的宇宙之外，一個任何夢境都無法觸碰到的地方；這股沒有確定身形的毀滅力量存在於最深的混沌裡，待在一切無垠的中央，翻滾冒泡，褻瀆著一切神明 － 那就是無所限制的惡魔之王阿撒托斯。沒有哪張嘴唇膽敢高聲言及它的名諱。在那些超越時間之外、讓人無法想像的黑暗巨室裡，污穢巨鼓敲打著隱約而又令人發瘋的迴響，邪惡長笛吹奏出的空洞而又單調的哀嚎。－ Howard Phillips Lovecraft
infotexts.campaignend3: 你的意識抵達了已知與未知的邊界，你仿佛觸摸到了真理之形，但又視之而不能見。應許之時未至，歸去吧。
infotexts.campaignend4: 你的眼前一黑... 你被徵召至一艘停靠在xxxx的yyyy潛艇，歐羅巴的大海向你敞開，而且比以往更為險峻。一股既視感向你襲來 － 你是不是經歷過這一切了？
infotexts.campaignend5: 在通過旅途的終點之後，你的冒險抵達了全新的開端，這一次還為你準備了更多風險。
infotexts.shrinkingmap: 隨著木星輻射強度的增加，木衛二的淺海區域逐漸變得危險不適人類遷徙居住。潛入更深的海域以躲避輻射。
infotexts.outpostmodulemaxcounttooltip: 同一個哨站中此模組的最多數量。
infotexts.outpostmoduletooltip: 一個哨站是由多個哨站模組相互組合而產生，如果要讓你的自訂哨站模組被使用於產生哨站，在儲存之後，必須手動為它建立內容套件並將存檔移入其中。
infotexts.readycheck.title: 確認準備
infotexts.readycheck.body: [player]發起了確認準備，你準備好了嗎？
infotexts.readycheck.serverbody: 伺服器發起了確認準備，你準備好了嗎？
infotexts.readycheck.readycount: 確認準備統計結束。已準備: [ready]/[total]。
infotexts.readycheck.pleasewait: 發起另一次確認準備前請稍後[seconds]秒。
infotexts.eventeditor.testpromptbody: Do you want to test the saved event in an empty outpost environment?
infotexts.saveradiochannelbuttontooltip: 保存目前的無線電頻道至頻道按鈕。
infotexts.dialoglowonweldingfuel: 船上剩沒多少焊接燃料罐了！
infotexts.dialoglowonoxygentanks: 船上的氧氣罐幾乎都是空的！有人能去幫忙填充那些空的罐子嗎？
infotexts.dialoglowoncoilgunammo: 電磁槍彈藥快沒了！以斷續方式開火！
infotexts.dialoglowonrailgunammo: 船上沒剩多少軌道炮彈藥。
infotexts.dialoglowonturretammo: 我們的彈藥快用完了，我們應該在下一站添購。
infotexts.dialoglowonfuelrods: 我們的燃料棒快用完了，我們要盡快添購一些，或者製作一些。
infotexts.dialogoutofoxygentanks: 我們的氧氣罐都是空的！
infotexts.dialogoutofcoilgunammo: 我們的電磁槍彈藥用盡了。
infotexts.dialogoutoffuelrods: 我們完全沒有燃料棒了！
infotexts.campaignoption.enableradiation.tooltip: 木星周圍的輻射帶強度漸漸增加，迫使木衛二上的人類逐漸深入它冰凍表殼之下。這個選項將迫使你推進至地圖上更危險的區域以驅使遊戲難度逐漸提升。
infotexts.radiationtooltip: 致命輻射量\n這個區域的木星輻射已經到達足以致命的等級，強烈建議不要在該地區內移動。
infotexts.nomissionprompt: 有可用的任務但並未選擇，你確定要不接受任務就離開嗎？
infotexts.entitydescription.rustdecal: Decorative decal for walls and machines
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutposthuman: [location1]最近沒了音訊，恐怕它已經被誰給霸佔了，摧毀哨站的反應爐讓他們再也不敢回來。
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutposthumans: 成功將霸佔者趕出哨站。
infotexts.missionfailure.abandonedoutposthumans: 並未摧毀哨站內的反應爐。
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutposthumans: 反應爐已被摧毀，這樣那些佔地為王的傢伙們就不會想再回到這裡了，與哨站分離以完成任務。
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutpostmonst: [location1]最近沒了音訊，恐怕它已經被具侵略性的生物佔據了，尋找並清除哨站中發現的卵。
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutpostmonsters: 成功清除哨站中的巢穴。
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutpostmonsters: 哨站上的巢穴已經被成功清除，與哨站分離以完成任務。
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutpostassas: [location1]最近沒了音訊，有報告指出一群惡名昭彰的法外之徒把那裡當作了自己的基地。他們的首領正被通緝 － 將其殲滅已獲得賞金。
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutpostassassina: 強盜首領已被成功殲滅。
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutpostassassin: 已成功殲滅強盜首領，與哨站分離以完成任務。
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutpostrescu: 一群最近佔據了[location1]的強盜放話要以求贖金交換一群被他們扣為人質的平民。聯盟不向恐怖分子打交道，但它們承諾會獎勵那些能解救人質的人。
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutpostrescue: 人質已經安全地登上潛艇，與哨站分離以完成任務。
infotexts.hostageskilled: 任務失敗；一位人質已被殺害。
infotexts.missiondescription.huntinggrounds: 一隻來自深淵的巨獸把這裡當成了牠的狩獵區域。在牠被消滅之前，鄰近地區將不會有新的哨站被設置，而現存的哨站則有可能被拋棄。
infotexts.missionsuccess.huntinggrounds: 深淵生物已經死亡，已經能夠相對安全地使用這條航線。
infotexts.missionfailure.huntinggrounds: 深淵生物仍然對附近的居民構成威脅。
infotexts.missionmessage0.huntinggrounds: 深淵生物已經死亡，已經能夠相對安全地使用這條航線。
infotexts.missiondescription.beaconnoreward: 根據導航系統顯示，這附近有一座停止運作的信號站。將它重新啟動能讓其他船艦更輕易地通過這裡，有助於殖民地的拓展。
infotexts.beaconstationactivetooltip: 這條航線上有一座運作中的‖color:gui.orange‖信號站‖end‖，它能幫助人們往其他地區拓展。
infotexts.beaconstationinactivetooltip: 這條航線上有一座停止運作的‖color:gui.orange‖信號站‖end‖，重新將它啟動幫助人們往其他地區拓展。
infotexts.huntinggroundstooltip: 有一隻深淵生物將這條航線通過的區域當成了自己的‖color:gui.orange‖狩獵區域‖end‖。在牠被消滅之前，鄰近地區將不會有新的哨站被設置，而現存的哨站則有可能被拋棄。
infotexts.enteremptylocation: 選擇一個目的地並離開此處
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.c1: “我聽說了不少與你的小對有關的事蹟，我替聯盟感謝你們所付出的行動。並非所有潛艇都被允許通過這個哨站前往更深的區域，不過歡迎你和你的隊員們通過這裡。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.c2: “你們想要通過這裡進到更深的區域？聯盟不允許新手船員進到那裡，你們的名聲也沒有好到能讓我心服口服放行。當然了，假如你們正好有5,000馬克能和我分享，或許那會一定程度地提升我對你們的看法...”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.o1.c1: “仔細想想，你們看起來潛力無窮，或許我確實是該讓你通過，很高興能與你們合作。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.o2.c1: “隨你便，或許你們的確需要在兒童池待久一點。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.nomoney: “錢不夠？太可惜了，在你能證明你真的有能耐之前或許你應該在兒童池待久一點。”
infotexts.pathunlockedgeneric: 通往下一個區域的通道已被開啟。
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.c1: “你們肯定在寒冷深隧裡忙得不可開交，我替聯盟感謝你們所付出的行動。你可能也注意到了，這裡是到達木衛二之脊前的最後一個哨站，並非所有潛艇都被允許通過這個哨站前往更深的區域，不過歡迎你和你的隊員們通過這裡。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.c2: “你們想要通過這裡進到更深的區域？聯盟不允許新手船員進到那裡，你們的名聲也沒有好到能讓我心服口服放行。當然了，假如你們正好有多的馬克能和我分享，或許那會一定程度地提升我對你們的看法。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o1.c1: “仔細想想，你們看起來潛力無窮，或許我確實是該讓你通過，很高興能與你們合作。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o2.c1: “隨你便，或許你們的確需要在兒童池待久一點。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o1.nomon: “錢不夠？太可惜了，在你能證明你真的有能耐之前或許你應該在兒童池待久一點。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.c1: “報告上說你們協助了木衛二之脊的殖民地拓展，因此我們決定給予你通往無光海原的許可，一路順風！”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.c2: “你們要去無光海原？我不知道... 我沒有看到你們以付出來證明你們的忠誠，而一份捐獻將帶來大大幫助。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.o2.c1: “哦？這樣的話希望你們能盡情享受在木衛二之脊的時光。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.o1.nomo: “非常抱歉，我不接受低於12,000馬克以下的貢獻，也許你們可以去搜刮幾個潛艇殘骸或是做做其他什麼你們平常拿來賺錢的事。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.c1: “我要恭喜你們，不是那麼多人能夠活著穿越無光海原，更別說同時還有貢獻的人了。我會通知他們讓你們能前往淵洋。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.c2: “我很抱歉，我知道你們長途跋涉，但我們不能冒險放行一支名不見經傳的小隊進到淵洋亂逛，這是為了你們的安全，你清楚的。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o1.c1: “我確定夠的，這不是聯盟的官方保證，也不是背書。我會通知守衛們你們有辦法保護自己。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o2.c1: “我相信你們能在這裡找個不錯的公寓來度過退休生活，至少輻射要好幾天才會抵達這裡。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o1.no: “大概15,000就能說服我了，不能更低，有的話再來吧。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.c1: “你想前往熱液廢土？聯盟怎麼會批准？不過那大概不關我的事，聯盟的朋友就是我的朋友，去吧。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.c2: “你有前往熱液廢土的許可嗎？想也知道沒有。你運氣不錯，我們正好在進行許可大拍賣，你懂的。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.o1.c1: “謝謝惠顧，歡迎再來，如果你回得來的話。”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.o1.nomoney: “這太少了，我的底價是19,000，你們湊到了再說。”
infotexts.servertag.friendlyfire.label: 隊友傷害
infotexts.servertag.voip.label: 語音聊天
infotexts.servertag.karma.label: 卡瑪
infotexts.servertag.traitors.label: 叛徒
infotexts.servertag.modded.label: Mods
infotexts.disconnectmessage.mismatchedworkshopmod: 下列內容套件與伺服器不符: [incompatiblecontentpackage]。你或伺服器主持人或許需要自遊戲中的Steam工作坊選單將其重新安裝。
infotexts.disconnectmessage.mismatchedworkshopmods: 下列內容套件與伺服器不符: [incompatiblecontentpackages]。你或伺服器主持人或許需要自遊戲中的Steam工作坊選單將它們重新安裝。
infotexts.sp.colorcomponent.usehsv.name: Use HSV
infotexts.sp.colorcomponent.usehsv.description: When enabled makes the component translate the signal from HSV into RGB where red is the hue between 0 and 360, green is the saturation between 0 and 1 and blue is the value between 0 and 1.
infotexts.disableingamehintstooltip: 防止任何遊戲內提示在遊戲中顯示。
infotexts.hintmessagebox.dontshowagaintooltip: 不要再顯示這個提示。所有提示可以自設定選單中關閉。
infotexts.hintmessagebox.disablehintstooltip: 停用所有提示。提示能自設定選單再度開啟。
infotexts.hint.onadjacenthull.highpressure: The area beyond this door is flooded with water under high pressure. Proceeding without a diving suit may be dangerous.
infotexts.hint.onadjacenthull.highwaterpercentage: A nearby room is currently filled with water. You might need to bring some diving gear with you.
infotexts.hint.onafflictiondisplayed: You've developed an affliction. Afflictions can be treated by pressing [key] to open the medical interface.
infotexts.hint.onautopilotreachedoutpost: The autopilot has navigated the sub to the outpost. Switch to manual control to move closer to the docking port.
infotexts.hint.onavailabletransition.returntoprevi: You have returned to the beginning of the level. Select a new destination to continue your journey, or close the map by pressing Esc.
infotexts.hint.onavailabletransition.progresstonex: You have reached the end of the level. Select a new destination to continue your journey.
infotexts.hint.oncharacterkilled: The character you were controlling has died. Switch to another crew member by opening the crew list to the top left of the screen and clicking on a portrait.
infotexts.hint.oncharacterunconscious: The character you were controlling has fallen unconscious. You can either wait for another crew member to heal you or give in by clicking on the button on the top of the screen.
infotexts.hint.ondivinggearoutofoxygen: You have equipped diving gear that lacks a sufficient oxygen source. Put in a new oxygen tank before using this gear.
infotexts.hint.onhandcuffed: You have been handcuffed and your capability to move or interact is limited. Someone else needs to uncuff you.
infotexts.hint.onisinteracting.reactorwithextrarod: Adding more than one fuel rod to the reactor is useful for jump starting it when it's submerged but will produce a dangerous rate of reaction under normal operation.
infotexts.hint.onreactoroutoffuel: The reactor has run out of fuel and the sub will run out of power. Replace the fuel rod to get power back on.
infotexts.hint.onrepairfailed: Failing to repair a device can cause you harm. Characters more skillful in mechanical or electrical repairs are more likely to succeed.
infotexts.hint.onroundstarted.voipdisabled: Turn on the voice chat in the setting if you want to communicate using your microphone.
infotexts.hint.onshootwithoutaiming: You'll need to aim by holding [key] before using this.
infotexts.hint.onshowcampaigninterface.map: Use the campaign map to select your next destination. After picking a destination, you can choose the mission you want to undertake.
infotexts.hint.onshowcommandinterface: Use the command wheel to issue commands to other crewmembers. Choose an order category, then the order. A suitable person will be assigned for the job.
infotexts.hint.onshowhealthinterface: This is the health interface. Choose a body part to see the afflictions affecting that part. Drag medical items from your inventory to administer them to a body part.
infotexts.hint.onsonarspottedenemy: Sonar is picking up a moving target. Make sure the sub's guns are manned and try to manouver so that your gunners have a clear shot.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.assistant: You're playing an assistant. Assistants are a jack-of-all-trades class. Be helpful where you can and develop your skills.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.captain: You're playing a captain. You should make your way to the command room and start navigating the submarine to the destination.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.engineer: You're playing an engineer. Engineers are responsible for keeping the submarine powered at all times. To do that, tend to the reactor and keep electrical equipment in good condition by repairing them.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.mechanic: You're playing a mechanic. You should keep an eye out on all the devices on the submarine and repair them if they break.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.medicaldoc: You're playing a medical doctor. Take care of your fellow crew and treat their injuries if they hurt themselves.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.securityof: You're playing a security officer. Take inventory of the weapons on board the submarine, arm the turrets in case of an enemy attack and keep the rowdy crew members in line.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.brokenitem: All devices on a sub will gradually break down over time, as this one has, and must be maintained for peak operating performance. Equip a screwdriver to repair electrical devices, and a wrench to repair mechanical ones.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.lootingissteal: Items with a red hand icon belong to someone else. If you take them, there will be consequences to deal with.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.turretperiscop: This periscope controls a submarine weapon. Use the mouse to look around and press [shootkey] to fire and [deselectkey] or 'ESC' to stop.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.deconstru: Use the deconstructor to break down items to their components. Insert an item to the input slot and press 'Deconstruct' to start the process.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.fabricato: Use the fabricator to craft items. Choose an item from the list, and if you have the required items in your inventory, press 'Create' to start fabricating.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.gunloader: This loader must be loaded with ammunition for the linked submarine weapon.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.navtermin: You can plot a course for the sub, set the autopilot, control the sonar, and monitor a side view of the sonar returns from here. Click on the sonar view to select direction. Use Mouse scroll wheel to zoom in and out.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.reactor: Nuclear reactors provide power to your devices. Try to keep the 'load' and 'output' the same, otherwise you'll likely suffer from blackouts or power spikes that damage your devices.
infotexts.hint.onstoleitem: You just stole something. This has hurt your reputation, and worse still, security will need to deal with you.
infotexts.hint.ontryopenstuckdoor: The door has been welded shut. You need a plasma cutter to open it.
infotexts.hint.onweldingdoor: You're welding a door shut. Once it's completely welded, you'll need to use a plasma cutter or crowbar to get it open again.
infotexts.hint.reminder.characterchange: If you wish, you can play as any of your crew by opening the crew list to the top left of the screen and clicking on a portrait.
infotexts.hint.reminder.commandinterface: You can give orders to the crew via the command wheel, which is displayed with [commandkey].
infotexts.hint.reminder.tabmenu: Press [infotabkey] to open the info tab where you can find information about things like your crew, your mission, and your reputation.
infotexts.hint.reminder.toolbelt: You have a toolbelt equipped. Hover over the icon in your inventory to access the toolbelt inventory.
infotexts.undockingdisabledbymission: 你無法在完成任務前自哨站分離。
infotexts.divingsuitwarning: 警告: 艙外壓力超過潛水服的承受極限。
infotexts.hostserverkarmasettingtooltip: 選取此項目將停用卡瑪。\n\n卡瑪是一個可自訂的自動管理系統，它會賦予執行有益及有害行為的玩家一項隱藏的分數，並有機會在分數太低時進行祭出處置。卡瑪能協助你管理公開伺服器，但你或許會希望和朋友一起更自由地互動。
infotexts.campaignstore.sellvaluetooltip: When buying things from you, merchants will always offer you less than what you paid for them. Item sell value is further affected by the merchant's balance and your reputation at the outpost, as well as slightly by the mood of the merchant.
infotexts.entitydescription.abyssdivingsuit: A heavy suit designed for deep sea exploration. Protects against damage and high pressure all the way down to 10,000 meters, reduces oxygen usage, but at a cost of reduced movement speed.
infotexts.entitydescription.combatdivingsuit: An agile, lightweight suit designed for combat. Offers some protection against damage and withstands pressure up to the depth of 6,000 meters.
infotexts.subeditor.loadconfirmbody: Are you sure you want to load the [submarine]? All unsaved changes will be lost.
infotexts.wikinotice: NOTICE: The wiki is maintained by volunteers, so it's possible some information is outdated. Please feel free to join and contribute yourself!
infotexts.respawnquestionprompt: Do you want to respawn with a penalty to your skills and health or wait for the next round to spawn as a new character?
infotexts.EventText.healreaperstax.c1: “I heard one of your crewmates has developed a rather unusual condition as of late, something we usually refer to as the 'Reaper's Tax'. If they're interested, I could take a shot at treating them.”
infotexts.EventText.healreaperstax.c2: “Oh, I see you're the unfortunate sailor in question! I could rid you of the condition for a measly sum of say, 1,000 marks. How's that sound?”
infotexts.EventText.healreaperstax.o1.nomoney: Not enough money? Tough luck, this ain't a charity.
infotexts.respawnwaitingformoredeadplayers: Waiting for a respawn... (Players waiting to respawn: [deadplayers]/[requireddeadplayers])
infotexts.hostagesdiscovered: The hostages have been located, but still need to be escorted out of the outpost safely. You may want to take their handcuffs off and order them to follow you.
infotexts.hint.onballastflorainfected: One of the ballast pumps is infected with ballast flora. Destroy the root with fire to kill it.
infotexts.entitydescription.turrethardpoint: 一個能夠用於搭載砲塔的底座。
infotexts.serversettingsallowwifichat: 允許將wifi元件連接至聊天
infotexts.entitydescription.unitloaddevice: 一個能夠容納許多箱子的容器。
infotexts.missionrewardcargo: 獎勵: [totalreward] ([itemcount] crates out of max [maxitemcount])
infotexts.entitydescription.railguncanistershell: A reloadable burst-type munition for the railgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.railguncanistershellpe: A pellet fired out of a canister shell.
infotexts.entitydescription.pulselaser: A large pulsed chemical laser attached to a turret, capable of firing intense beams of energy after charging up. Inflicts extreme burns on anything it hits.
infotexts.entitydescription.pulselaserammobox: A box of arranged chemicals and a focusing lens, useful for inducing intense bursts of energy. Used as ammo by the Pulse Laser.
infotexts.entitydescription.chaingun: A powerful multiple-barrel turreted weapon, based on coilgun technology. Though somewhat unwieldy and slow to wind up to its firing state, its capability to deliver a hail of high-velocity metal at any would-be foe is unparalleled.
infotexts.entitydescription.chaingunammobox: A heavy box of ammo for the Chaingun.
infotexts.dialogoutofchaingunammo: 我們沒有機關槍彈藥了。
infotexts.dialogoutofpulselaserammo: 我們沒有脈衝雷射燃料了。
infotexts.dialoglowonchaingunammo: 機關槍彈藥快沒了！以斷續方式開火！
infotexts.dialoglowonpulselaserammo: 船上沒剩多少脈衝雷射燃料了。
infotexts.eventtext.clownrelations1.o1.c1: The box contains bike horns, masks and oversized shoes. As you’re rummaging through it, a posse of people dressed in clown suits march down the hallway. One of them walks straight up to you, then stares at your hand. You realize you’re still holding a bike horn.
infotexts.dialogmentalstateconfused: Huh... I must be seeing things.
infotexts.dialogmentalstatedesperate: Shut up. Shut up. Shut up.
infotexts.dialogmentalstateberserk: It will all be over soon.
They won't trouble us for long.
infotexts.dialogmentalstatereactiondefensive: I won't let you take me!
infotexts.dialogmentalstatereactionarrest: I won't let you hurt me!
I have to put you down!
infotexts.dialogterroristannounce: This ship belongs to the Jovian Separatists!
This ship will serve the Separatists well!
You must all die for the revolution!
The Jovian Separatists shall be victorious!
The Jovian Separatists shall rule Europa!
infotexts.missiontypedescription.escort: 在哨站之間運送人員並同時確保他們的安全。
infotexts.missiontypedescription.pirate: 找到海盜的船艦並將它的船員與其一同殲滅。
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort1.c1: “Some of the commoners here are looking for safe passage to a nearby station. Escort them over there safely and you'll be paid.”
infotexts.missiondescription.escort1: A number of commoners must be transported to [location2]. Take care not to endanger their lives, as you will only be paid your reward of [reward] marks if none of them die.
infotexts.missionmessage0.escort1: Too many of the escorted personnel have perished at sea. The mission is a failure.
infotexts.missionfailure.escort1: Escorted personnel did not reach their destination.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort2.c1: “A highly esteemed medical expert and their armed escort are looking for transportation to a nearby station. Their safety is of utmost importance.”
infotexts.missiondescription.escort2: A highly valuable person and their armed escort must be transported to [location2]. Take care not to pose any unnecessary risk to the VIP, as you will only be paid a reward of [reward] marks if they survive.
infotexts.missionmessage0.escort2: Too many of the escorted personnel have perished at sea. The mission is a failure.
infotexts.missionfailure.escort2: Escorted personnel did not reach their destination.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort3.c1: “We have a few prisoners that need to be transferred to a prison on another station. You'll be paid well for their transportation, but be aware that they need to be closely guarded.”
infotexts.missiondescription.escort3: A group of prisoners need to be transported to a high-security prison located in [location2] to be paid [reward] marks. Make sure these prisoners are well-guarded during your voyage, as they may try to escape. Do not let any of them die.
infotexts.missionmessage0.escort3: Too many of the escorted personnel have perished at sea. The mission is a failure.
infotexts.missionfailure.escort3: Escorted personnel did not reach their destination.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort4.c1: “We believe that Separatist terrorists have snuck among the innocent civilians looking to leave on the next transport ship. If you're willing to have your ship act as that transport, you might be able to draw the terrorists out into the open and detain them. Just make sure the civilians survive.”
infotexts.missiondescription.escort4: Separatist terrorists have been hijacking ships in this sector. We believe some of them have snuck onto your ship alongside innocent passengers. Make sure the innocent civilians make it to [location2] alive, and deal with any terrorists that reveal themselves, and you'll be paid a reward of [reward] marks.
infotexts.missionsuccess.escort4: Personnel transport successful, and the terrorists have been dealt with.
infotexts.missionfailure.escort4: Escorted personnel did not reach their destination, or the terrorists were not uncovered and neutralized.
infotexts.missionmessage0.escort4: Too many of the escorted personnel have perished at sea. The mission is a failure.
infotexts.missionmessage1.escort4: Looks like that was the last of the terrorists. Navigate the submarine to [location2] to claim your reward.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_pirate1.c1: “A rogue vessel has been preying on our cargo shipments. Eliminate its crew, and we will show our graditude. Take care though, the ship is heavily armed.”
infotexts.missiondescription.pirate1: Seek out the pirate vessel that has been terrorizing this area and eliminate its crew to gain a reward of [reward] marks. The marked locations show where the ship has last been sighted.
infotexts.missionsuccess.pirate1: The pirate vessel's crew was successfully eliminated.
infotexts.missionfailure.pirate1: The pirate vessel's crew was not eliminated.
infotexts.missionmessage0.pirate1: Neutralize the crew or sink the submarine to the bottom of the sea!
infotexts.missionmessage1.pirate1: Navigate the submarine to [location2] to claim your reward.
infotexts.eventtext.atwitsend.c1:
A gaunt young man walks up to you, a bottle of liquor in hand. Despite appearances, he speaks to you in a peppy tune:

"Hey, the name's Artie Dolittle. You came here on that ship, right? You should take me with you!"
infotexts.eventtext.atwitsend.o1.c1: "Because I'd be a great employee! I'm good at everything and I'll even work for free! How's that sound?"
infotexts.eventtext.atwitsend.o1.o2.c1: "Oh. Can't blame a guy for trying though, right?"
infotexts.dialogturrethasnopower: 無法開火！砲塔無法運作！
infotexts.dialogreactorisbroken: 我需要人來修理反應爐！
infotexts.dialognavterminalisbroken: I need someone to fix導航終端！
infotexts.EventText.stowaway1.c1: Hmm. This box wasn't here before.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway1.o1.c1: It is a regular storage crate found all over Europa, identical to the ones you receive your supplies in. You bend down and try to open it. However, as you start lifting the lid, something slams it back down.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You hold your breath and put your ear next to the crate. You can hear rustling from inside.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You successfully wrestle the lid off. To your surprise, a small crawler jumps out ready to claw your eyes out!
infotexts.EventText.stowaway1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c2: You successfully wrestle the lid off. Lying on top of a saline shipment is a small creature. It eyes you carefully, then crawls out of the crate and looks at you expectantly. It seems like you have made a friend.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.c1: Noises are coming out of this cabinet. As you approach it, they grow quiet.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.c1: When you open the cabinet door, a harlequin in unusual garb steps out. They greet you formally and explain that they are a messenger.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o1.c1: The jester explains that there is a sunken submarine nearby. It was carrying an item of tremendous value to the Honkmother. The messenger doesn't wait for your answer. Instead, they turn on their heels and leave you to ponder.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.c2: You carefully open the cabinet door, only to reveal a mouth-agape, wide-eyed young person hiding in it. By the looks of them, they are in their late teens.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.c1: “N-nobody special, I guess”, the teen stammers.
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.c1: “Me and a couple of friends snuck on board while you were visiting [location]. I was stuffed in here by them, as a joke.” They sniff. “I guess they heard you coming and ran back into the station. I swear I didn't mean to stay here for this long.”
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1: “What am I going to do with you?”
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.c1: “W-well, I'd like to go back home. If you don't want to go back, I guess I can hop onto a shuttle on the next station.”
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o1.c1: The teen climbs out of the cabinet. “Thanks. I'll stay out of trouble, I promise.”
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o2: “You'll get off at the next stop.”
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o3: “Come out. You're working for me now.”
infotexts.EventText.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o3.c1: “Are you serious?”, the teen whines. Yes, you are. That'll teach them to sneak on board strange vessels.
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.c1: A radio is blaring nearby. A man with a raspy voice is yelling about something.
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.c1: “Well we've all heard about this nonsense about so-called clown brutality. As if for some reason clowns are being sought out and roughed up because of how they look. Let me tell you, it's got nothing to do with the color of their makeup and everything to do with how they choose to carry themselves!”
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.o1.c1: “In fact, in this latest incident, I can only imagine how it would have unfolded if the jester in question had been wearing a suit and a tie instead of oversized shoes and a ridiculous wig! And instead of running away, they could've gone “Yes, sir”, “No, sir”, and they'd be on their merry way right now! But no. The take-away here, dear listeners, is: clown around and your brains will end up all over the walls.”
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.signoff: “And that's all the time we have for now. Remember, listen and obey. Maurice! Hold the cards up! Maur- No! What does that even mean?” The person in the booth sounds very irate. “Maurice, I swear to- What do I even pay you for?” The broadcast suddenly stops and is replaced by static.
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.c2: “Recreational drug use is on the rise, people. Have you heard about “Cult of the Husk”? A bunch of weirdos abusing biohazardous materials? And the establishment does nothing about it!”
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.o2.c1: “And don't get me started on casual opioid use that's rampant everywhere! According to trusted sources, the Coalition is putting something in them, making them addicting! Before too long, it'll be your children, squatting away in abandoned outposts, wearing dirty robes, doing whatever substances they can get their grubby hands on.”
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.c3: “Dear listeners, if I was the Coalition president, I would walk right into the crew quarters, set up my little podium and say, “Listen, citizens, if you vote against military spending and a separatist army marches in and blows you up, we're not going to do anything about it.””
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.o3.c1: “You want to cry about your ruined little station? Give us your money next time! Anyway, that's what I would say, if I was the president.”
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.c4: “What a bunch of bullshit. Don't believe everything you hear on the radio.”
infotexts.EventText.shockjock.o1.o4.c1: “It's some weird hermit who's built a makeshift radio station somewhere. Nobody knows where, otherwise somebody would have put a stop to it already. The guy gets on everybody's nerves.”
infotexts.EventText.assassinationofjacovsubra1.o1: Take a look at the ID card.
(The ID card belongs to one Jacov Subra. Where have I heard that name before? Oh well.)
infotexts.EventText.assassinationofjacovsubra2.c1: A worker, presumably on break, is reading the paper. “Hey, you hear about that Subra guy?”
“Jacov Subra. He's a weird guy who put together these - how should I put it - “themed” festivals.” The person rolls their eyes. “Full of husks. Multiple fatalities. He had a high profile trial a while back. You might have read about it on the Europan. Anyway.”
“They caught him here a week ago. From what I heard, he had held another disastrous festival nearby, and was sent to the mines.”

“Good news, until he slipped away again.” A tone signals that the break is over. The worker puts the paper away and starts towards the dock. “I hear they put up a reward for whoever brings him to custody”, they yell over their shoulder.
infotexts.EventText.assassinationofjacovsubra3.c1: “Welcome to the annual “Church of the Mollusc” festival! Featuring: Sonata Aquatica, Jethro Hull, Irma-Donna, Draft Bunk and many more! With a special appearance by Sacov Jubra!” The word “mollusc” is written on top of a scribbled out “husk”. Seems like the festival is being held nearby. A passerby exclaims: “Draft Bunk is playing! Sweet!”
infotexts.EventText.assassinationofjacovsubra4.o1: “Give up, Jacov! You're coming with me!”
“I'm not going anywhere! I'm innocent! Look, I'll pay you!”
“Been there, done that.” Jacov smiles devilishly. “What makes you think I won't run away again?”
“I can see your heart isn't in this. I'll give you three thousand marks and you let me walk out of here. Deal?”
infotexts.EventText.assassinationofjacovsubra4.nev: “Here's the money. We never saw each other.”
infotexts.EventText.assassinationofjacovsubra4.run: As soon as the words leave your lips, Jacov hurls a fistful of coins at your head and turns to run away.
“Maybe I'll put a bullet in your leg.”
Jacov is sweating profusely. “Surely you wouldn't shoot an unarmed man?”
“Three thousand for you and we part as friends, right here.”
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.c1: The station manager looks at you with haggard eyes. “You're one of the new arrivals? Man, am I glad to see a non-masked face.”
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1: “Now that you mention it, there are a lot of masks around.”
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.c1: “A bunch of clowns. Let me ask you, you ever wake up in the middle of the night to a sound of bike horns? They don't even attempt any kind of melody, just honking away all willy-nilly. I haven't had a full night's sleep in... days?” They stare blankly into space. “Weeks?”
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.c1: “Who knows? I've tried talking to them, offering money, threatening to kick them out, you name it, I've tried it. I think they're content with torturing me and the rest of the crew.”
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.c1: “The manager scoffs. “Tell you what. You get them to leave, there's a...” Their eyes narrow as they study you. “Thousand marks for you. One more thing. No physical violence. While I personally wouldn't shed any tears for roughed up clowns, we have rules here we adhere to.”
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.c1: You approach a clown. They stare at you.
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.c1: You stare the clown down for a minute. They try to grab your nose but you slap their arm away. You point to the direction of the airlock. With slumped shoulders, the clown shuffles away, their friends in tow.
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.o1: It's suddenly very quiet. You report your success to the manager on the radio and one thousand marks are deposited to your account.
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.c2: You strain to flex your biceps. For some reason this only succeeds in making the clown laugh in your face and continue their merriments.
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.o2: You have missed your chance at making an impactful impression and dejectedly report failure to the station manager.
infotexts.EventText.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o2.c1: You try to reason with the clowns, explaining that their behaviour is disrupting the lives of the crew here and frankly, quite unacceptable. Your words fall to deaf ears.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations1.c1: A sound of shattering glass makes you jump. Someone is slouched against the wall, shards of glass at her feet. By the looks of it, it might have been a bottle of rum she was holding. She's muttering under her breath.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations1.o1.c1: No response. You notice she's repeating the same thing over and over. “Bad vibrations, man. Bad vibes.” Drool is slowly dripping from the corner of her mouth onto her jacket.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations1.o1.o1.c1: You're wondering about the person's mental health, when they unexpectedly swing around and grab you by the collar. “Bad vibrations, do you hear me?” A sudden realization dawns on her when she recognizes you as a member of a submarine crew. “You can help me”, she pleads. “We found a relic. Turned it on. In the structure. Deep.” She lets up her grasp on you for a second.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations1.o1.o1.o1.c1: The madness seems to have found it's way back to cloud her mind. “I was first! I know! I got the trophy!”
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations1.raving: You wonder what the person is raving about. A relic inside a structure? Something in the ruins? You make a note to check it out if you have time.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations2.c1: Touching the artifact's etched surface causes an almost imperceptible itch inside your head.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations2.o1.c1: For some reason, you find it very difficult to drop the item, and it remains in your hands. The itch builds up into a slight vibrating feeling in your skull.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations2.o1.o1.c1: It's as if you've forgotten how to move your arms. Your head feels uncomfortably warm and numb. It's getting more and more challenging to keep your focus on anything.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations2.o1.o1.o1.c1: You close your eyes. This seems like as good a place as any to have a nap. Jupiter knows you've earned one. You let yourself fall back into a dreamless sleep.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations2.protrusion: As you run your hands across the item's surface, you hit a protrusion. At once, the numbness inside subsides and you are again fully aware of your surroundings. Time to get this artifact somewhere it can be kept safe.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations3.c1: Somebody is trying to get your attention. “Hey! I've been looking for you.” She looks vaguely familiar. “You don't remember me, do you?”
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations3.o1: “Oh yeah, you're the one with the, uh, vibrations.”
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations3.gotbetter: “So, I got better. Suppose that is because you turned the thing off?” She crosses her arms. “Wanted to come say thanks.”
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations3.anotherthing: “There's another thing. Because I was... unwell, I got booted from the crew I was with back then. I was thinking I could join up with you guys? I'm pretty handy with all things mechanical or electrical.” She looks strong and capable now that she's not being hindered by an external influence.
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations3.hangout: “Well, I guess I'll hang out here 'til I find something.”
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations3.scrounge: “Oh. Uh, I can scrounge up a few hundred marks if you like. I'll send 'em to you as soon as possible.”
infotexts.EventText.badvibrations3.o2.c1: “Huh?” She looks confused and mildly annoyed. “No, you're mistaking me with someone else. I ran into you earlier when I was still having... trouble with a certain relic. You know, with the “bad vibes” and all.”
infotexts.EventText.manandhisraptor1.c1: A distressed looking person is pacing in circles in the hall. When they see you, their eyes light up. “You're from that sub that just docked, aren't you? Do you take passengers?”
infotexts.EventText.manandhisraptor1.o1: “I am indeed. What type of passengers?”
